list.abs: as Father Ralph came in holding Meggie's hand , her malevolent gaze beat the child's down .当拉尔夫神父拉着麦琪的手走进来时，她那恶毒的眼光马上压倒了孩子。

what tuberculosis was to the 19th century , cancer is to the 20th , an insidious , malevolent force that frightens people all reason far more than , say , diabetes or high blood pressure .19世纪的肺结核以及20世纪的癌症是如此狡猾与邪恶的势力，他们给当时人们带来的恐慌与理智的丧失远比糖尿病和高血压严重的多。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin malevolent- 'wishing evil', from male 'ill' + volent- 'wishing' (from the verb velle)

entry.tran: 狠毒的;恶毒的；存心不良的
entry.def: A malevolent person deliberately tries to cause harm or evil.

example.ex: Her stare was malevolent, her mouth a thin line.

means.word_mean: 1. wishing or appearing to wish evil to others; arising from intense ill will or hatred;

sentences.sentence: "failure made him malevolent toward those who were successful"

means.word_mean: 3. having or exerting a malignant influence;
